paragraph: S\u00E3o Tom\u00E9 and Pr\u00EDncipe, officially the Democratic Republic of S\u00E3o Tom\u00E9 and Pr\u00EDncipe, is an island country in the Gulf of Guinea, off the western equatorial coast of Central Africa. It consists of two archipelagos around the two main islands of S\u00E3o Tom\u00E9 and Pr\u00EDncipe, about 150 km (93.21 mi) apart and about 250 and 225 km (155 and 140 mi) off the north-western coast of Gabon. With a population of 201,800 (2018 official estimate), S\u00E3o Tom\u00E9 and Pr\u00EDncipe is the second-smallest and second-least populous African sovereign state after Seychelles.
